column4: when i do "aptitude install vlc" I get this: The following packages will be REMOVED:
binfmt-support{u} bsd-mailx{u} dctrl-tools{u} debhelper{u} debootstrap{u}
devscripts{u} dh-make{u} diffstat{u} dput{u} fakeroot{u} gettext{u}
html2text{u} intltool-debian{u} libapr1{u} libaprutil1{u}
libauthen-sasl-perl{u} libdevel-symdump-perl{u} libio-pty-perl{u}
libio-stringy-perl{u} libipc-run-perl{u} libmail-sendmail-perl{u}
omg that was supposed to be on one line sorry guys
but what I was gettin at is are any of those important
For whom?
I wouldn't want to uninstall those, at least. :-)
I have both fakeroot and vlc installed at the same time, though, so something is wrong.
should I just try to install it from source? or what?
Um, which package exactly does it conflict with
I'm not sure, all I know is that it has that huge list of what will be removed
for the most partim just running a basic xubuntu setup
What does vlc conflict with? It looks like it's just vlc-nox to me.

i did apt-get install and it's telling me this: The following packages were automatically installed and are no longer required: debootstrap fakeroot python-pyinotify diffstat libmono0 debhelper intltool-debian postfix patchutils libapr1 po-debconf subversion libpod-coverage-perl libmail-sendmail-perl libsvn1 libdevel-symdump-perl gettext libio-stringy-perl devscripts libipc-run-perl dctrl-tools libauthen-sasl-perl dput libparse-deb
Yes, you said that. It doesn't say very much...
Does `apt-cache show vlc` say it conflicts with something?
Conflicts: vlc-nox (<< 0.9.2-1)
It means exactly what it says.
Those "packages were automatically installed and are no longer required".
No, it's not installed.
You'll get that message no matter what you install.
